intro: Arctotis hispidella, commonly known as the hispid daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow center surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its species name "hispidella." It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Arctotis hispidella is also valued for its long blooming period, which extends from late winter to early summer.
